Name: Wink
Ingredients: 5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
2 dash Peychaud's or other Creole-style bitters
Instructions: Select and pre-chill an Old-fashioned glass .
Prepare garnish of orange zest twist.
TOP with chilled water and set to one side.
Separately, SHAKE other ingredients with ice.
DISCARD contents of glass (absinthe, water and ice).
FINE STRAIN cocktail into empty absinthe-coated glass.
EXPRESS orange zest twist over cocktail and discard.
Review: Reminiscent of a Sazerac but with gin and triple sec. Delicate, remarkably fruity and very sippable.
History: Created in 2002 by Tony Conigliaro at The Lonsdale in Nottinghill, London, England.
Nutrition: One serving of Wink contains 205 calories
